summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit (SHU) for July 23, 2019. It records staff observations of inmates in locked-down status, with signatures for each time slot, and includes standard operating procedure instructions for irregular checks. The document is significant as it provides a record of prison monitoring procedures on the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell.

events.title: Daily Inmate Monitoring
events.description: Routine 30-minute observation checks of inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York were conducted throughout the day, as documented on multiple check sheets.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Special Housing Unit (SHU) dated July 23, 2019.
It details a 30-minute check procedure for inmates in continuous locked-down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation.
The procedure requires staff to observe each inmate at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule, with all observations documented.
The sheets include time frames, start/end times, and staff signatures for multiple tiers (ZA Tier-H, L-Tier, M-Tier, ZA Tier-J, ZA Tier-K, ZA Tier-G, ZB).
The document was reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant Captain, indicating a chain of custody and oversight for the monitoring logs.
